p: The variable quality in sharing model code and methodological detail shown here does suggest that epidemic model reporting consensus guidelines, which establish a minimum standard for the reporting of epidemic modeling, may be valuable. A recent review of the modeling efforts for the Ebola epidemic also called for standardization of modeling practice [ 104]. Many other fields of biomedical research have established reporting guidelines to improve research quality and implementation [ 127â€“ 130]. While reporting guidelines have been proposed for population health modeling on a broader scale [ 131], none have been established for epidemics.
